name: Blast
author: Christiam Camacho, Thomas Madden, George Coulouris, Vahram Avagyan, Ning Ma, Tao Tao, Richa Agarwala
description: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI). These applications have been revamped to provide an improved user interface, new features, and performance improvements compared to its counterparts in the NCBI C Toolkit. Hereafter we shall distinguish the C Toolkit BLAST command line applications from these command line applications by referring to the latter as the BLAST+ applications, which have been developed using the NCBI C++ Toolkit (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=toolkit.TOC&depth=2).

commands.name: blastx
commands.description: Which compares a nucleotide query sequence translated in all reading frames against a protein sequence database.

parameters.name: best_hit_overhang
parameters.description: Overhang value for Best-Hit algorithm. For more details, see the section Best-Hits filtering algorithm.

parameters.name: out
parameters.description: Name of the file to write the application’s output. Defaults to stdout.

parameters.name: best_hit_score_edge
parameters.description: Score edge value for Best-Hit algorithm. For more details, see the section Best-Hits filtering algorithm.

parameters.name: db
parameters.description: File name of BLAST database to search the query against. Unless an absolute path is used, the database will be searched relative to the current working directory first, then relative to the value specified by the BLASTDB environment variable, then relative to the BLASTDB configuration value specified in the configuration file.

parameters.name: dbsize
parameters.description: Effective length of the database.

parameters.name: dbtype
parameters.description: Molecule type stored or to store in a BLAST database.

parameters.name: db_soft_mask
parameters.description: Filtering algorithm ID to apply to the database as soft masking for subject sequences. The algorithm IDs for a given BLAST database can be obtained by invoking blastdbcmd with its -info flag (only shown if such filtering in the BLAST database is available). For more details see the section Masking in BLAST databases.

parameters.name: culling_limit
parameters.description: Ensures that more than the specified number of HSPs are not aligned to the same part of the query. This option was designed for searches with a lot of repetitive matches, but if possible it is probably more efficient to mask the query to remove the repetitive sequences.

parameters.name: entrez_query
parameters.description: Restrict the search of the BLAST database to the results of the Entrez query provided.

parameters.name: evalue
parameters.description: Expectation value threshold for saving hits.

parameters.name: export_search_strategy
parameters.description: Name of the file where to save the search strategy (see section titled BLAST search strategies) .

parameters.name: gapextend
parameters.description: Cost to extend a gap.

parameters.name: gapopen
parameters.description: Cost to open a gap.

parameters.name: gilist
parameters.description: File containing a list of GIs to restrict the BLAST database to search. The expect values in the BLAST results are based upon the sequences actually searched and not on the underlying database.

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: Displays the application’s brief documentation.

parameters.name: help
parameters.description: Displays the application’s detailed documentation.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: Enables the generation of HTML output suitable for viewing in a web browser.

parameters.name: import_search_strategy
parameters.description: Name of the file where to read the search strategy to execute (see section titled BLAST search strategies) .

parameters.name: lcase_masking
parameters.description: Interpret lowercase letters in query sequence(s) as masked.

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: Name of the scoring matrix to use.

parameters.name: max_target_seqs
parameters.description: Maximum number of aligned sequences to keep from the BLAST database.

parameters.name: negative_gilist
parameters.description: File containing a list of GIs to exclude from the BLAST database.

parameters.name: num_alignments
parameters.description: Number of alignments to show in the BLAST output.

parameters.name: num_descriptions
parameters.description: Number of one-line descriptions to show in the BLAST output.

parameters.name: num_threads
parameters.description: Number of threads to use during the search.

parameters.name: outfmt
parameters.description: Allows for the specification of the search application’s output format. A listing of the possible format types is available via the search applications -help option. If a custom output format is desired, this can be specified by providing a quoted string composed of the desired output format (tabular, tabular with comments, or comma-separated value), a space, and a space delimited list of output specifiers. The list of supported output specifiers is available via the -help command line option. Unsupported output specifiers will be ignored. This should be specified using double quotes if there are spaces in the output format specification.

parameters.name: parse_deflines
parameters.description: Parse the query and subject deflines.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Name of the file containing the query sequence(s), or ‘-‘ if these are provided on standard input.

parameters.name: query_loc
parameters.description: Location of the first query sequence to search in 1-based offsets (Format: start-stop) .

parameters.name: remote
parameters.description: Instructs the application to submit the search to NCBI for remote execution.

parameters.name: searchsp
parameters.description: Effective length of the search space.

parameters.name: seg
parameters.description: Arguments to SEG filtering algorithm (use ‘no’ to disable) .

parameters.name: show_gis
parameters.description: Show NCBI GIs in deflines in the BLAST output.

parameters.name: soft_masking
parameters.description: Apply filtering locations as soft masks (i.e.: only when finding alignment seeds) .

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Name of the file containing the subject sequence(s) to search.

parameters.name: subject_loc
parameters.description: Location of the first subject sequence to search in 1-based offsets (Format: start-stop) .

parameters.name: strand
parameters.description: Strand(s) of the query sequence to search.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Minimum word score such that the word is added to the BLAST lookup table.

parameters.name: ungapped
parameters.description: Perform ungapped alignments only.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Displays the application’s version.

parameters.name: window_size
parameters.description: Size of the window for multiple hits algorithm, use 0 to specify 1-hit algorithm.

parameters.name: word_size
parameters.description: Word size for word finder algorithm.

parameters.name: xdrop_gap
parameters.description: X-dropoff value (in bits) for preliminary gapped extensions.

parameters.name: xdrop_gap_final
parameters.description: X-dropoff value (in bits) for final gapped alignment.

parameters.name: xdrop_ungap
parameters.description: X-dropoff value (in bits) for ungapped extensions.

parameters.name: query_gencode
parameters.description: Genetic code to use to translate the query sequence(s).

parameters.name: frame_shift_penalty
parameters.description: Frame shift penalty for use with out-of-frame gapped alignments.

parameters.name: max_intron_length
parameters.description: Length of the largest intron allowed in a translated nucleotide sequence when linking multiple distinct alignments (a negative value disables linking).

outputs.name: outFile
outputs.description: Name of the file to write the application’s output. Defaults to stdout.

parameters.description: Overhang value for Best-Hit algorithm. For more details, see the section Best-Hits filtering algorithm.

parameters.description: Name of the file to write the application’s output. Defaults to stdout.

parameters.description: Score edge value for Best-Hit algorithm. For more details, see the section Best-Hits filtering algorithm.

parameters.description: X-dropoff value (in bits) for final gapped alignment.

parameters.name: xdrop_ungap

parameters.name: in
parameters.description: Input file or BLAST database name to use as source; the data type is automatically detected. Note that multiple input files/BLAST databases can be provided, each must be separated by white space in a string quoted with single quotation marks. Multiple input files/ BLAST databases which contain white space in them should be quoted with double quotation marks inside the white space-separated, single quoted string.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title for the BLAST database to create

parameters.name: parse_seqids
parameters.description: Parse the Seq-id(s) in the FASTA input provided. Please note that this option should be provided consistently among the various applications involved in creating BLAST databases. For instance, the filtering applications as well as convert2blastmask should use this option if makeblastdb uses it also.

parameters.name: hash_index
parameters.description: Enables the creation of sequence hash values. These hash values can then be used to quickly determine if a given sequence data exists in this BLAST database.

parameters.name: mask_data
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of input files containing masking data to apply to the sequences being added to the BLAST database being created. For more information, see Masking in BLAST databases and the examples.

parameters.name: max_file_sz
parameters.description: Maximum file size for any of the BLAST database files created.

parameters.name: logfile
parameters.description: Name of the file to which the program log should be redirected (stdout by default).

parameters.name: taxid
parameters.description: Taxonomy ID to assign to all sequences.

parameters.name: taxid_map
parameters.description: Name of file which provides a mapping of sequence IDs to taxonomy IDs.

outputs.name: outFile
outputs.description: Name of the file to write the application’s output. Defaults to stdout.
